definitions.title: n.m.
definitions.body: cinnamon (prob. foreign wd., coming with the thing from remote E., cf. M‘Lean-ThDyer Ency Bib.s.v.; cp. with Malay kainamanis by Röd:Thes. Add. l1l, kāyü mānĭ s Lewy:Fremdw.37, but only kāyu, wood, given by Scott:Mal. Words in Eng. JAOS xviii, (1896,1897); Gk. kinna/mwn from Heb. (against Lag BN 199));—fragment bark used as spice: abs. ´[[ק]]: Pr 7:17, Ct So 4:14; cstr. [[קִנְּמָן־בֶּשֶׂם]] Ex 30:23(P) cinnamon of sweet odour.—Vid. also Houghton-Tr:Smith D B s.v. Post:Hastings DB s.v.
